prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism has a slightly tapered shape, with the narrowest point at the top. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other. *Step 1: Create a new coordinate system* Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] *Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane* Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created in step 1. The sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1) containing four lines: *Line 1*: * Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] * End Point: [0.75, 0.0] *Line 2*: * Start Point: [0.75, 0.0] * End Point: [0.75, 0.75] *Line 3*: * Start Point: [0.75, 0.75] * End Point: [0.0, 0.75] *Line 4*: * Start Point: [0.0, 0.75] * End Point: [0.0, 0.0] *Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale scaling parameter* After drawing the 2D sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch\\_scale scaling parameter. *Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector* With the scaled 2D sketch, transform it into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system created in step 1. *Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model* Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.0333 units. This will result in a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The narrowest point of the prism is at the top, and the sides of the prism are parallel to each other. The dimensions of the prism are: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.0333 units</description>
